intro: Ferula laseroides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and narrow, aromatic leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers in umbels, typical of the family, and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Ferula laseroides is valued for its medicinal properties, with its resin and essential oils used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological contexts.
